metadata.title: CVE-2021-21704 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.29, 7.4.x below 7.4.21 and 8.0.x below8.0.8, when using Firebird PDO driver extension, a malicious databaseserver could cause crashes in various database functions, such asgetAttribute(), execute(), fetch() and others by returning invalid responsedata that is not parsed correctly by the driver. This can result incrashes, denial of service or potentially memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.8
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.8
php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.8
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.8

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.8').
